byline.contributor: Al Baker, Michael Schwirtz and Michael Winerip contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Up to 20 senior members of the Police Department have been interviewed recently by federal agents focused on two businessmen with ties to Mayor Bill de Blasio, according to three people familiar with the matter.

headline.print_headline: Investigation of 2 Businessmen Linked to Mayor Pulls In Top Police Officials
headline.main: Police Leaders Questioned Amid Inquiry of Businessmen Linked to de Blasio

snippet: Up to 20 senior members of the Police Department have been interviewed recently by federal agents focused on two businessmen with ties to Mayor Bill de Blasio, according to three people familiar with the matter.
abstract: Roughly 20 senior members of New York City Police Dept have been questioned by FBI as part of inquiry into Jona Rechnitz and Jeremy Reichberg, businessmen and members of Orthodox Jewish community who served on inaugural committee for Mayor Bill de Blasio in 2013; questions have centered on whether police officials received free meals and trips from lobbying organizations associated with Rechnitz and Reichberg.
